translated: the five basic precepts,üîΩnot to eat meat,üîΩnot to handle gold or silver,üîΩnot to sleep on a high or luxurious bed,üîΩnot to handle women,üîΩnot to touch the body of a woman,üîΩnot to go near a woman,üîΩnot to go to see or hear performances,üîΩand not to eat at the wrong time.

original: dge slong la khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: dge slong la khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The fully ordained monk has two hundred and fifty-three precepts.

original: byang chub sems kyi sdom pa la nyi shu tham pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi sdom pa la nyi shu tham pa /
translated: The bodhisattva vows number twenty.

original: sngags kyi dam tshig la rang gi dam tshig dang sngags pa'i gnyis so //
analyzed: sngags kyi dam tshig la rang gi dam tshig dang sngags pa'i gnyis so //
translated: The tantric pledges are of two kinds: the pledges of the proclaimers and the pledges of the tantric adepts.

analyzed: de tsho yod tshad yar ldan du brtsi sngags kyi sdom pa'i khog tu brtsi gsungs//
